data.description: A fence is a freestanding structure designed to restrict or prevent movement across a boundary. It is generally distinguished from a wall by the lightness of its construction.

A wall is a freestanding structure, designed to restrict or prevent movement across a boundary, typically made from solid brick, concrete or rocks, and almost always built so that it is opaque to vision.
A section in a wall or fence which can be opened to allow access.
A hedge is a line of closely spaced shrubs and tree species, which form a barrier or mark the boundary of an area.
Solid (usually concrete or metal) pillar or pillars in the middle of the road to prevent passage by some traffic.
A lift gate (boom barrier) is a bar, or pole pivoted in such a way as to allow the boom to block vehicular access through a controlled point.

A retaining wall is a structure that holds back soil or rock from a building, structure or area. Retaining walls prevent downslope movement or erosion and provide support for vertical or near-vertical grade changes. Right side is bottom, left side is top
A structure which provides people a passage through or over a boundary via steps, ladders or narrow gaps.
Barriers along paths that slow or prevent access for bicycle users.
An opening or gap in a barrier.
Large immobile block(s) barring free access along a way.
Kerb limiting the passage of vehicles.
A place where a road usage toll or fee is collected.
A hole in the road surface covered in a series of bars that allow wheeled vehicles but not animals to cross.
A section in a wall or fence which can be opened to allow restricted access.
A city wall, a fortification used to defend settlements in ancient to modern times
A man made ditch or trench to prevent access to the other side.
A guard rail is typically a metal rail designed to keep vehicles within their roadway and prevent dangerous collisions
A chain used to prevent motorised vehicles.
A passage on foot through a fence
Control point at an international border between two countries
[[w:en:Handrail
A short section of the roadway where there is a deep dip in the middle to prevent passage by some traffic.
